New Records: West Indies defeated Papua New Guinea by 5 wickets in their T20 World Cup opener.
Key Match Events: West Indies reached 137/5 in 19 overs, chasing PNG's 136/8.
Roston Chase scored an unbeaten 42 off 27 balls.
Adil Rashid took 2 wickets for 19 runs.
Papua New Guinea were all out for 136 in 20 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies won the toss and chose to bat first.
Papua New Guinea were looking to make it a strong start in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies coach expressed satisfaction with the team's performance.
Papua New Guinea showed fighting spirit but fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Georgetown.
It was Papua New Guinea's first match in the tournament.
Others: The match was part of the T20 World Cup 2024.
